description:
A library to ease the creation of Selenium WebDriver instances in .net Core projects.

Usage

IWebDriver localWebDriver = StaticWebDriverFactory.GetLocalWebDriver(Browser.Firefox, Path.GetDirectoryName(Assembly.GetCallingAssembly().Location));

or 

IWebDriver remoteWebDriver = StaticWebDriverFactory.GetRemoteWebDriver(Browser.Chrome, gridUri, Platform.Linux);

Supported Browsers:
Chrome
Firefox
Edge (Windows 10 version 1803 Only)
Internet Explorer 11 (Windows Platforms)
Safari (MacOS)

Platforms:
Windows
Linux
MacOS

Tested and working on Windows 10 and Linux.
It SHOULD work on MacOS (at least for Firefox and Chrome) but is currently untested.

The repository at
https://github.com/AlexanderOnTesting/NetCoreWebDriverFactory


contains test projects for Windows Linux and MacOS. These can be used to test your setup and demonstrate the options available.
releaseNotes:
v0.9.6 Release Candidate
10 October 2018
Apologies to those of you who pulled the earlier failing versions.
*** Breaking changes***
It appears that reflection cannot be used from a .net Standard library to find the Calling Assembly so my efforts to find the DriverPath fail.
To ensure that a path can be set or not as required (Safari and the latest version of Edge should NOT require a path set) I have now added the driverPath as a parameter for GetLocalWebDriver calls.
The suggested path to use from your .net core project is given in the xml documentation.

v0.9.4
9 October 2018
Allow passing of path and debugging.

v0.9.3
8 October 2018
Fixed Path calculation to account for use in a package. Third time lucky.

v0.9.2
8 October 2018
Fixed Path calculation to account for use in a package.

0.9.0
First release: 5 October 2018
Local and Remote WebDriver creation made easy
